alert.note: Alert for Lenawee (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 8:57PM EDT by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Lenawee County through 1000 PM EDT... At 856 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Addison to 6 miles northwest of Fayette to near Pioneer. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Hudson around 900 PM EDT. Clayton around 905 PM EDT. Morenci and Onsted around 910 PM EDT. Adrian around 925 PM EDT. Blissfield and Britton around 940 PM EDT. Deerfield around 945 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Seneca, Manitou Beach-Devils Lake, Macon, Lime Creek, Munson, Ogden Center, Canandaigua, Ridgeway, Palmyra and Tipton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
